name: just a rectangle crochet danbury bag
notes:

looking for a crochet bag pattern that's as addictive as your favorite show? the rectangle crochet danbury bag is your answer! it's a beginner-friendly project that even the most notorious gossip columnist (ahem, lady w) would approve of.

with its simple stitch repeat and two-seam construction, you can effortlessly craft your own stylish bag while keeping up with the latest episodes.

this bag pattern comes with a video tutorial.

crochet hook:
[g (4.0mm) - or size to meet gauge][1]

notations:
[removable stitch marker][2]
[yarn needle to weave in ends][3]
[scissors][4]
[faux leather snap][5]

yarn:
[wecrochet comfy worsted][6]
75% pima cotton, 25% acrylic, 109yds/50g

yardage:
380 yds
for a solid bag - 4 balls
for a striped bag in 3 colors - color a: 2 balls, color b: 2 balls, color c: 1 ball

abbreviations
ch - chain
dc - double crochet
sc - single crochet
sk - skip
sl st - slip stitch
st(s) - stitch(es)

gauge:
18 sts x 15 rows unblocked= 4x4” in stitch pattern

not sure what gauge is? check out this blog post: [what is crochet gauge and how to fix it][7]

sizes:
one size - bag rectangle measures 30" x 10" before folded.

skill level:
beginner
